original: Dahlström, Erik Mauritz, folkskollärare, rektor, Alingsås, f. 18/5/90 i Gbg av järnv:tj:man Martin D. o. Maria Rahm. G. 18 m. Helfrid Hasselskog. B’arn: Gösta f. 19, Lars 23. — Folksk :lär :ex. i Gbg 13, kantors- o. kyrkosångarex. 13, organistex. i Linköp. 19, hand rkurser i Gbg 34-36. Res. t. Danm. o. Finl. f. stud. av prakt, ungdisk. o. yrkessk :väs. 39. E. lär. v. Gbgs folksk. 13-15, ord. folksk :lär. v. Alingsås folksk. sed. 16, musiklär. v. Alingsås samrealsk. 19-21 o. 27, rektor v. Alingsås stads yrkessk. sed. 39. Led. av musei- o. arkivndn, biblistyr., planter :komm., kulturella komm. o. kyrkofullm. 38, ordf. i Alingsås djur-o. naturskyddsfören. 18-39. Skr.: Mönsteralfabet, Hembygdskartor över Alingsås stad o. dess omgivn. samt Naturminnesmärken o. fornminnen i Alingsåstrakten. Sv res djurskydds-fören. riksförb. förtj :GM 46, Sv. allm. djurskyddsfören. SM jämte dipl. 40.
translated: Dahlström, Erik Mauritz, elementary school teacher, principal, from Alingsås, born on May 18, 1890 in Gothenburg to railway worker Martin D. and Maria Rahm. Married to Helfrid Hasselskog since 1918, with two children: Gösta born in 1919 and Lars born in 1923. He graduated from elementary school teacher program in Gothenburg in 1913, choir singer program and organist program in 1913 and 1919 respectively, and took business courses in Gothenburg from 1934-1936. He traveled to Denmark and Finland in 1939 to study practical education and vocational schools. He worked as a teacher at Gothenburg elementary school from 1913-1915, and as an elementary school teacher in Alingsås since 1916. He was a music teacher at Alingsås secondary school from 1919-1921 and 1927, and became the principal of the Alingsås vocational school in 1939. He was a member of museum and archive committees, bible study groups, plant communities, cultural committees, and church council since 1938, and served as the chairman of the Alingsås animal and nature protection association from 1918-1939. He wrote "Pattern Alphabet," "Local Maps of Alingsås city and its surroundings," and "Natural Monuments and Ancient Monuments in the Alingsås area." He received the Order of Merit from the Swedish Animal Protection Association in 1946, and the Swedish Animal Welfare Association's medal along with a diploma in 1940.

structured.name: Erik Mauritz Dahlström

memberOf.name: Alingsås animal and nature protection association

structured.description: Erik Mauritz Dahlström was a Swedish elementary school teacher, principal, and author from Alingsås. He was born on May 18, 1890 in Gothenburg to railway worker Martin D. and Maria Rahm. He was married to Helfrid Hasselskog since 1918, with two children: Gösta born in 1919 and Lars born in 1923. Dahlström graduated from elementary school teacher program in Gothenburg in 1913, choir singer program and organist program in 1913 and 1919 respectively, and took business courses in Gothenburg from 1934-1936. He traveled to Denmark and Finland in 1939 to study practical education and vocational schools. He worked as a teacher at Gothenburg elementary school from 1913-1915, and as an elementary school teacher in Alingsås since 1916. He was a music teacher at Alingsås secondary school from 1919-1921 and 1927, and became the principal of the Alingsås vocational school in 1939. Dahlström was a member of museum and archive committees, bible study groups, plant communities, cultural committees, and church council since 1938, and served as the chairman of the Alingsås animal and nature protection association from 1918-1939. He wrote "Pattern Alphabet," "Local Maps of Alingsås city and its surroundings," and "Natural Monuments and Ancient Monuments in the Alingsås area." He received the Order of Merit from the Swedish Animal Protection Association in 1946, and the Swedish Animal Welfare Association's medal along with a diploma in 1940.
